channel.title: Galois on Z&Z Mathematics
channel.description: Recent content in Galois on Z&Z Mathematics

item.title: Could it really be a sum of cube roots?
item.description: In a recent ARML practice session this interesting problem came up: $$\text{Express }\sqrt[3]{\sqrt[3]{2}-1}\text{ as the sum of three real cube roots of rational numbers.}$$ No one was able to solve it but they did have access to Wolfram Alpha and Wolfram Alpha gave a solution! What could have motivated such a problem in the first place? Here we will attempt to reason out the solution and see if we can reverse engineer a motivation.
